intro: Horkelia unguiculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Horkelia unguiculata is often found in open areas with full sun exposure and is adapted to arid environments.
